task_summary: Robot is tasked to pick up a pan from a blue surface by perceiving, approaching, aligning, and grasping it with the gripper.

task_long_description.overview: In this episode, a robotic arm is instructed to pick up a white pan with a black handle resting on a blue surface. The robot must locate the pan, approach from above, compute a suitable grasp, precisely align, and close the gripper to achieve a secure pick-up. Visual cues and object proximity dominate the process, and stable grasp is required. The robot retries visual search if the pan isn't immediately visible.
preconditions: Pan is present in the workspace
stepwise_plan: Move above pan at a safe offset
Compute grasp pose using top strategy
Approach and align with tight tolerance
Confirm pan is in the gripper
success_criteria: No collision or object slip detected
All steps executed within timeout limits
failure_and_recovery: Object not visible: retry scan up to 3 times
Poor grasp: abort and retry perceive-approach-grasp loop
task_long_description.termination: Tree terminates upon successful grasp and confirmation that pan is held. Stops on hard failure or after defined retry attempts.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if pan is visible in the scene
Scans workspace for pan up to 3 times, grid pattern
Computes top grasp pose for pan
Approaches and aligns with pan, tight tolerance
Closes gripper with minimum safe force

failure_modes: Timeout exceeded during approach or grasp
recovery_strategy: Retry scan up to 3 times if pan not visible
Abort and reset if grasp fails
assumptions: Frames depict only the perceive→approach→align→grasp sequence, not transfer or place
No evidence of a multi-object scene
Instruction matches observed pan; no conflict detected

expected_success_criteria: Pan lifted and stable in gripper
All actions complete within time bins
